author: Rhys Chamberlain
title: Transport Minister Simon Bridges rejects offer to experience poor Queenstown driving
text:
Dad jailed for suffocating his toddler daughter Transport Minister Simon Bridges rejects offer to experience poor Queenstown driving RHYS CHAMBERLAIN Last updated 12:42, February 22 2017 Damon Forde 
Damon Forde captured this footage of a driver on the Crown Range road near Queenstown on January 26. 
Transport Minister Simon Bridges won't accept a challenge to come and experience Queenstown driving. 
Bridges was on Tuesday challenged by freelance cameraman Damon Forde to take a drive with him around the region so he could experience "how bad it is". 
Forde's challenge to the Minister came after a video he posted on Facebook of a shocking driver on the Crown Range , racked up over 200,000 views. ANDY JACKSON/FAIRFAX NZ 
Transport Minister Simon Bridges. 
A one-line emailed statement on Wednesday from Bridges' press secretary Kirsty Martin said: "The Minister drives all over New Zealand regularly and so doesn't believe a trip with Mr Forde is necessary." 
READ MORE: 
Forde said he felt the Minister was "naive and burying his head in the sand" over the issue. DAMON FORDE 
A "tourist" driver on the wrong side of the road on the Crown Range in January 26. 
"I think the Minister need to spend a few days down here and see how bad it is. There is a serious issue." 
The Government needed to stop "pussy-footing around", Forde said. 
On Tuesday Forde said: "I'd like to see the Transport Minister come down here and take a drive with me and see how bad it is. The invitation's open." Ad Feedback 
Forde's video shows a blue "rental car" driven by a "tourist" repeatedly crossing the centreline.

The driver was given an infringement notice, police said. - Stuff
